This metric measures the average difference between the predicted values and the actual values of soil pH and %OM. The study reported RMSEP values of 1.12 and 0.89 % for %OM determinations in shallow and deeper topsoils, respectively. For pH determinations, the RMSEP values obtained were 0.25 and 0.34. 

The RMSEP values indicate the average magnitude of the errors in the predictions. Lower RMSEP values indicate higher accuracy, as they represent smaller differences between the predicted and actual values. In the related study, the RMSEP values obtained for both %OM and pH predictions were relatively low, suggesting that the models had a high level of accuracy.

However, it is important to note that the RMSEP alone does not provide a complete assessment of the model's performance. Other metrics such as RPIQ (Ratio of Performance to Interquartile Distance) and R-val (2) (coefficient of determination) were also used in the related study to evaluate the models. These additional metrics provide further insights into the model's predictive power and overall performance.
